DRAFT - query FRS API to find latest info on EPA facilities by registry ID or program ID

Source: R/utils_locate_by_id.R
locate_by_id.Rd

FUNCTION IS NOT FULLY WORKING/TESTED

Usage

locate_by_id(idx, type = "frs", simple = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

idx

vector of one or more character strings that must be registry IDs (default) or program IDs

type

either frs (default) or program. frs means all are registry_id and program means all are pgm_sys_id

simple

use simpler method

...

passed through to locate_by_id1()

Value

data.frame with one row per queried id, columns as returned by API but lat lon instead of Latitude83 Longitude83

Details

May want to use latlon_from_programid() and latlon_from_regid() instead.

Uses the Facility Registry Service (FRS) API to find a site by registry ID or program ID. This uses an API to find sites, but it is faster to look in a table if that FRS dataset is already loaded in an app, for example.

see url_by_id() for more details

See also

?latlon_from_programid() and ?latlon_from_regid() and url_by_id() and the obsolete locate_by_id()

Examples

  # \donttest{

  ids <- testinput_program_sys_id
  ids <- paste0(ids$program, ids$pgm_sys_id)
  # ids <- c('ILR000128264','600039382','TXR1592DZ','TSCA8851',
  #    'CT0000000900908716', 'CEDRI10043548',  'CO0000000812305826')
  # ids <- c('ILR000128264','600039382')
  locate_by_id(ids, type = 'program')   # stopped working   ***********
# }
